column1: I think his point is that the BKN FO has proven itself competent enough that -- unlike the post-LeBron Cavs -- the Nets likely wouldn't become a total dumpster fire even if all the stars left in their option years. BKN would find some sneaky solid guys in the G League; eat some salaries of guys who are still OK, just overpaid; get some picks that way and get some decent draftees; be well-coached; be in the East; etc., the end result being that they'd suck, but they'd suck in a 12th-pick-in-the-draft way rather than being a favorite for one of those guaranteed top 5 spots. So HOU ends up coming out of it with a Sekou Doumbouya, a Jaxson Hayes, a couple Ty Jeromes, and a Mfiondu Kabengele... for James fucking Harden.

Mfiondu Kabengele
To give you context since you obv didnt watch the game and decided to talk shit:   Clip's rookie center Mfiondu Kabengele, whose third year option was not picked up by the team, made a three pointer.

The article suggested Bev, Lou Will, Zubac, and Mfiondu Kabengele (25th overall in 2019). I'd also throw in Terance Mann. Not horrible since the Raps could flip Bev for assets, they need some solid bigs like Zu, Lou Will might like playing for his old team with no pressure, and it doesn't hurt to have young projects like Mann and Fi. However, I'd be shocked if that was the highest bid.

Exactly, there's nothing that can get this deal done. That being said, I always thought Mfiondu Kabengele is like the perfect player for a team like the Raptors to turn into a high-quality rotation player.   Our player development is so questionable.
Of everyone on Cleveland, open shot with the fate of the universe on the line or the Martians have the death beam pointed at Earth and you better hit it, I want Mfiondu Kabengele
